skill.name: accessibility-check
skill.description: Evaluate accessibility and WCAG compliance of UI components and pages. Use when the user asks to "check accessibility", "audit a11y", "WCAG review", "screen reader test", or needs to verify inclusive design practices.
skill.summary: Evaluate accessibility and WCAG compliance of UI components and pages. Use when the user asks to "ch...
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing WCAG 2.1 guidelines and accessibility audit templates. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands are present. The skill operates solely through prompt-based content delivery.

content.value_statement: This skill evaluates UI components and pages against WCAG 2.1 guidelines. It identifies accessibility issues and provides specific fixes. Use it to ensure your interfaces are usable by people with disabilities.
actual_capabilities: Evaluate UI components against WCAG 2.1 Level A and AA criteria
Identify missing alt text, labels, and semantic HTML issues
Check color contrast ratios for readability
Review keyboard navigation and focus indicators
Provide code examples for common accessibility fixes
limitations: Cannot run automated testing tools like axe-core or pa11y
Cannot test actual screen reader output or keyboard navigation
Requires manual verification of automated audit results
Does not perform visual testing across zoom levels

use_cases.title: Code review accessibility
use_cases.description: Review React components for WCAG compliance before merging pull requests

use_cases.title: Design system audit
use_cases.description: Audit component libraries for accessibility gaps and inclusive design issues

use_cases.title: Compliance verification
use_cases.description: Verify products meet accessibility requirements for legal compliance

prompt_templates.title: Quick component check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check accessibility of this button component. Is it keyboard accessible? Does it have proper focus states?

prompt_templates.title: Form validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this form for accessibility issues. Check labels, error messages, and keyboard navigation.

prompt_templates.title: Full page review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility audit of this page. Check perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Integration check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run both the accessibility check and UX audit on this dashboard. Focus on contrast, navigation, and ARIA usage.

output_examples.input: Check accessibility of this button: <button class="btn">Click me</button>
output: Issues Found: Missing accessible name, no focus styles visible
Fix: Add aria-label or text content, ensure visible focus indicator with 2px outline
WCAG Criteria: 2.4.7 Focus Visible, 4.1.2 Name Role Value
Code Example: <button class="btn" aria-label="Submit form">Click me</button>

best_practices: Run accessibility checks before every feature release
Combine automated testing tools with manual keyboard testing
Include people with disabilities in user testing when possible
anti_patterns: Using placeholder text instead of proper form labels
Relying solely on color to convey information
Skipping accessibility testing until the end of development

faq.question: What WCAG levels does this skill check?
faq.answer: This skill covers WCAG 2.1 Level A and Level AA criteria, the standard targets for most compliance requirements.

faq.question: Does this replace automated testing tools?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidelines and code reviews. Use axe-core or pa11y for automated testing in your CI pipeline.

faq.question: Can I use this with Playwright tests?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill references Playwright integration for automated accessibility testing alongside manual review.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reviews code you provide. No data is stored or transmitted to external services.

faq.question: Why did my accessibility audit fail?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing alt text, low color contrast, missing form labels, and missing focus indicators. Review the specific issues listed.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual testing?
faq.answer: This skill identifies code-level issues. Manual keyboard and screen reader testing catches runtime behavior that code review cannot.
